item.description:
This will be a brisk, varied-terrain hike around the Goodwin and Natchaug Forest area to see our beautiful October foliage in full brightness. The trails can be rocky and wet, but aren't too steep. The hike will take around 2 hours. You'll need hiking boots and water/snacks.

We'll meet at the parking area opposite the Nature Center/Museum at 23 Potter Road, Hampton.

Weather dependent, so check here the morning of the hike to see if we're going. More details will follow. :)

It's supposed to be bright sunshine and in the low 50s tomorrow, so it looks good! We will be leaving the parking lot for the hike promptly at 1.00. If you change your mind about coming, please change your RSVP or ring me on 860-634-6541.

group.name: The NorthEast Connecticut Friends Meetup Group

item.name: Autumn Colors Hike
